article.headline: South Alabama 67, Louisiana-Monroe 60
article.story: MOBILE, Ala. -- DeAndre' Coleman scored 21 points and had 10 rebounds to lead South Alabama to a 67-60 victory over Louisiana-Monroe on Saturday night. Brandon Davis added 16 points and 14 rebounds as the Jaguars (17-11, 10-7 Sun Belt Conference) won their fourth consecutive game and sixth in their past seven. South Alabama shot 46.6 percent from the field (27 of 58). But the Warhawks (9-18, 5-11), who have lost three straight, were only 20 of 57 from the field (35.1 percent). The Jaguars also went 11 of 24 from the free-throw line. South Alabama built a 15-point lead with 8 minutes left. Louisiana-Monroe cut the advantage to single digits but couldn't get closer than the final margin. Domonic Tilford added 11 points for the Jaguars. Lawrence Gilbert scored 14 points and Malcolm Thomas and Kenneth Averette added 11 points each for the Warhawks.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
